snippet: The men attacked officers trying to enter an apartment in the northeastern city of Shenyang, the authorities said, but Uighur advocates questioned the account.
abstract: Police in Shenyang, China, say they shot and killed three men who they said belonged to terrorist group; Uighur representatives are questioning official account.

byline.contributor: Adam Wu contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The men attacked officers trying to enter an apartment in the northeastern city of Shenyang, the authorities said, but Uighur advocates questioned the account.

headline.main: Chinese Police Say 3 Killed by Officers Were ‘Xinjiang Terrorists’
headline.print_headline: 3 Killed by Chinese Officers Belonged to Terror Group, Police Say
